content: loops you left unused in row 9 of the body beret row instructions stitches 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 6 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around 12 3 *single_crochet in 1 single_crochet increase in next* around 18 4 *single_crochet in 2 single_crochet increase in next* around 24 5 *single_crochet in 3 single_crochet increase in next* around 30 6 *single_crochet in 4 single_crochet increase in next* around 36 7 *single_crochet in 5 single_crochet increase in next* around 42 8 *single_crochet in 6 single_crochet increase in next* around 48 9 *single_crochet in 7 single_crochet increase in next* around 54 10 *single_crochet in 8 single_crochet increase in next* around 60 11 *single_crochet in 9 single_crochet increase in next* around 66 12 *single_crochet in 10 single_crochet increase in next* around 72 13 14 work even single_crochet in each single_crochet around 72 15 *single_crochet in 4 single_crochet decrease* around 60 16 *single_crochet in 3 single_crochet decrease* around 48 17 using half_double_crochet 48 work even half_double_crochet in each single_crochet around bind off and weave in your ends hair using dark brown yarn make 12 inch lengths you can use a book cardboard or i wrapped the yarn around my crochet hook case the long way use a crochet hook to pull the yarn through the head placing the hair in a natural fashion you don t need to fill every row see below page 6 of 7 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com finishing up more pics of the finished doll page 7 of 7 designed by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com
